meanings.definition: A person who works at a dock, loading and unloading ships.
meanings.sent1: The dockworkers unloaded the cargo from the ship.
meanings.sent2: The dockworkers are essential for moving goods from the dock to the ship.
meanings.sent3: The dockworkers had a race to see who could unload the ship the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The dockworkers are the backbone of the shipping industry.
meanings.sent5: The dockworkers toiled under the hot sun to finish unloading the ship.

meanings.definition: The group of workers employed at a dock for the purpose of handling cargo.
meanings.sent1: All the dockworkers gathered to discuss their workload for the day.
meanings.sent2: The dockworkers formed a union to advocate for better working conditions.
meanings.sent3: The dockworkers organized a potluck to celebrate a successful month.
meanings.sent4: The dockworkers function like a well-oiled machine when unloading a ship.
meanings.sent5: The dockworkers' teamwork and efficiency impressed the dock manager.
